intro: Christella acuminata var. kuliangensis, commonly known as the Kuliang bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
